channel.title: Working on New RuneScape Hiscores
channel.description: As some of you may know, RuneScape updated their hiscores. Now, I'm trying to implement their's. Here's what I have so far: http://sagescape.zapto.org/highscores/new.php

item.title: Working on New RuneScape Hiscores
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

Davidi2:

It does look like you probably just used the hi-score tutorial and then changed the CSS + images + some html =/

Some of it is the hiscores tutorial. I’ve been doing this mostly by myself.

Read full topic

item.title: Working on New RuneScape Hiscores
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

[quote=“sageofmali, post:11, topic:395221”][quote author=Slave Scyth link=topic=492409.msg3600443#msg3600443 date=1305503102]

[quote author=Epic Steve link=topic=492409.msg3600441#msg3600441 date=1305502896]

[quote author=Slave Scyth link=topic=492409.msg3600407#msg3600407 date=1305501613]

[quote author=Epic Steve link=topic=492409.msg3600400#msg3600400 date=1305501422]

congratulations. you saved their page and edited a few snips of data to say GayScape.

I’m working on the php. So, suck my balls. I had to change all of the css and had to get all the images.
[/quote]It’s “PHP”, not “Php”. (Bottom of the page)

Did you really just correct someone because they didn’t capitalise an acronym? Seriously what has this website become?
[/quote]So if you were to make a website, you’d be able to deal with permanent misspellings? Typing on a forum and writing text for a website are 2 completely different things. Websites are professional, and look disgusting if things are misspelled or just plain wrong. On forums poor grammar is expected.

Yes, I did correct him; because he’s wrong.

Looks good, but I don’t like the new RS website, maybe because i’m on a shit old XP desktop with wireless adapter that’s slow. Good job.

and actually, you use <?php not <?PHP so, it doesn’t matter what acronyms you use as stated above.
[/quote]<?php is part of the code, not the name of the language. Nice try, though.

EDIT: And by definition, acronyms are capitalized. You already contradicted yourself.

Not all acronyms are capitalised though.
[/quote]Such as?

WoW :)[/quote]WoW is capitalized, actually.

Function words like ‘of’, ‘the’, etc. are the exception with acronyms. But show me an acronym that doesn’t start off capitalized.

Read full topic

Websites are professional, and look disgusting if things are misspelled or just plain wrong. On forums poor grammar is expected.

Yes, I did correct him; because he’s wrong.

Looks good, but I don’t like the new RS website, maybe because i’m on a shit old XP desktop with wireless adapter that’s slow. Good job.

and actually, you use <?php not <?PHP so, it doesn’t matter what acronyms you use as stated above.
[/quote]<?php is part of the code, not the name of the language. Nice try, though.

EDIT: And by definition, acronyms are capitalized. You already contradicted yourself.

Not all acronyms are capitalised though.
[/quote]Such as?[/quote]
WoW
